intro: Meconopsis bikramii, commonly known as the Bhutan blue poppy, is a striking flowering plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows, and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a splash of color to its rugged habitat. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is considered a symbol of Bhutan and is protected in its natural range.
